001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004
005/**
006 * A {@link DimensionLossFunction} that computes the squared error
007 * between an estimated value and its target value.
008 *
009 * <p>
010 * The squared error is defined as:
011 * <pre>
012 * SE = (estimated - target)^2
013 * </pre>
014 * </p>
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * This loss function penalizes larger deviations more heavily than
018 * smaller ones, making it widely used in regression problems and as
019 * the basis of the Mean Squared Error (MSE) objective.
020 * </p>
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * When combined with a {@link ScaledError} (e.g., with a factor of
024 * {@code 0.5}), it produces the conventional MSE formulation:
025 * <pre>
026 * MSE = 0.5 * (estimated - target)^2
027 * </pre>
028 */
029@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
030public class SquaredError implements DimensionLossFunction {
031
032    /**
033     * {@inheritDoc}
034     */
035    @Override
036    public float calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target) {
037        return (target - estimated) * (target - estimated);
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * {@inheritDoc}
042     */
043    @Override
044    public float calculateGradient_dl_da(float estimated, float target) {
045        return 2 * (target - estimated);
046    }
047
048}
